docs.lead_paragraph: Some see ketamine as an effective drug for some patients, and others see it as a dangerous hallucinogen that has not been studied enough.

headline.main: Special K, a Hallucinogen, Raises Hopes and Concerns as a Treatment for Depression
headline.print_headline: Club Drug Gets a Second Look

docs.abstract: Small studies at prestigious medical centers suggest that ketamine, anesthetic widely abused as a club drug, can relieve depression in many people who are not helped by conventional antidepressants; some psychiatrists express alarm that clinics are springing up to offer ketamine treatments for depression; pharmaceutical companies are aiming to develop drugs that work like ketamine but without side effects.
docs.snippet: Some see ketamine as an effective drug for some patients, and others see it as a dangerous hallucinogen that has not been studied enough.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health economist apologized to a House panel for making “glib, thoughtless” comments about the American public when assessing the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Jonathan Gruber of M.I.T. Regrets ‘Arrogance’ on Health Law
headline.print_headline: Economist Says He’s Sorry for ‘Arrogance’ on Health Law

docs.abstract: Health economist Dr Jonathan Gruber testifies before House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and apologizes for negative remarks about American public's understanding of health care reform law; Gruber, paid consultant for Obama administration in assessing Affordable Care Act, says his comments were inaccurate and unacceptable and praises law in his testimony.
docs.snippet: The health economist apologized to a House panel for making “glib, thoughtless” comments about the American public when assessing the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: Top lawmakers Tuesday released a massive 1,603 page, $1.1 trillion omnibus spending bill funding every government agency but the Department of Homeland Security through Sept. 30. The measure also contains dozens of policy provisions affecting financial regulations, the environment, school lunches, and new regulations requiring truckers get more rest. Provisions include:

headline.main: Major Provisions of $1.1T Omnibus Spending Bill
headline.print_headline: Major Provisions of $1.1T Omnibus Spending Bill

docs.lead_paragraph: MIT economist Jonathan Gruber — an often-quoted adviser on the president's health care law — told Congress on Tuesday he was glib and "inexcusably arrogant" when he said it was "the stupidity of the American voter" that led to the law's passage. Democrats tried to limit the damage as Republicans raked Gruber at a four-hour hearing, but acknowledged he gave the GOP a political gift "wrapped in a bow."

headline.main: Obama Health Adviser Apologizes for 'Glib' Remarks
headline.print_headline: Obama Health Adviser Apologizes for 'Glib' Remarks

docs.lead_paragraph: A report raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; some listed doctors were not taking new patients, and others had long since left the location where they were listed.

headline.main: Half of Doctors Listed as Serving Medicaid Patients Are Unavailable, Investigation Finds
headline.print_headline: Half of Doctors Listed as Serving Medicaid Patients Are Unavailable, Investigation Finds

docs.abstract: Report by Health and Human Services Dept raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; says half of doctors listed as serving Medicaid patients are unavailable, and one-third are not even at their listed address.
docs.snippet: A report raises questions about access to care for Medicaid beneficiaries; some listed doctors were not taking new patients, and others had long since left the location where they were listed.

headline.main: Walking Away From a Customer Who Demands a Discount

docs.abstract: Over time, our pricing evolved into a tier system: Tier 1 is the higher profit work, Tier 2 is lower profit. Our discount-seeker is Tier 2.
docs.snippet: Over time, our pricing evolved into a tier system: Tier 1 is the higher profit work, Tier 2 is lower profit. Our discount-seeker is Tier 2.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the latest religious challenge to the federal health care law, faith-based organizations that object to covering birth control in their employee health plans argued in federal appeals court Monday that the government hasn't gone far enough to ensure they don't have to violate their beliefs.
